Pesto
0.5 - 1 clove garlic
15g cedar nuts
50g Basil leaves
20g parmesan
80ml olive oil (something mild)
1g salt
  1. Pound and grind the nuts and garlic in a mortar and pestle, until pulverised
  2. Rinse the basil, chop, add to the mortar with a little salt, and grind again until well broken down
  3. Add cheese and oil, grind a third time until it froms a smooth green paste
  4. Carefully test and adjust the salt as necessary
Notes
  • The amount of garlic varies wildly depending on how strong it is. So start with half a clove if you're not sure
  • Cheese - to be correct, this should really be a mix of parmesan/fiore sardo or parmesan/pecorino
  • Nuts - this uses cedar nuts instead of pine nuts, since they're way cheaper and i can't tell the difference
  • Some recipes suggest adding a small amount of butter. This probably gives a creamier result when you mix it with pasta and cooking water, as per the serving suggestion
  • Can also be done in a food processor, but won't be quite as good
Serving Suggestions
  • Mix with your choice of pasta and a few spoons of the pasta cooking water
